item.title: Manager, Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

The Data Analytics Manager will assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals.  These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms. 

What will you do?

  • Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.
  • Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s). 
  • Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit. 
  • Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions. 
  • Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit.
  • Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.
  • Create and maintain foundational data & analytics initiatives that provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned in the platform(s).
  • Support effective delivery of a pipeline of data analytics and automation initiatives that impact Audit execution activities globally across all regions and lines of business.
  • Support the prioritization of analytics based on areas of best return; deciding on accept/decline analytics and automation activities for the Lab to execute on; hosting regular cadence with lab stakeholders; ensuring analytics initiatives are tracked in central repository.
  • Acts as a peer to the Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the centralized Data Management & Analytics team (DMA).
  • Empowered to challenge and refine the value of analytics ideas as proposed by the auditors
  • Conduct research and identify opportunities for improving processes and technology: Externally, research best practices, emerging risks, and innovation across RBC and broadly throughout the financial sector. Internally, gather, understand, and analyse auditors’ pain points.
  • Size potential upside of deploying a solution across platforms, in line with your findings. In partnership with technical experts and other stakeholders, define and articulate ROI for your business cases for Executive Selection Committee approval.
  • Support technical builds and process reengineering aligned with business cases at every step of analytics lifecycle; engage auditors as needed and support user acceptance testing across your platforms.
  • Support the communication of ongoing work to broad Internal Audit audience and support creation of training materials and experiences for selected tools.
  • Support the adoption of centrally developed data products in the platform with support from the DMA team and global adoption of IA wide data initiatives.
  • Support technology use and reuse by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the Internal Audit toolkit.
  • Assist in review of quarterly Audit plan for existing tool use to reduce duplication of efforts and to ensure technology provides expected return.
  • Support gathering and triage feedback for technical experts on an ongoing basis
  • Mentor team members - assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects.
  • Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors

What do you need to succeed?

  • Bachelor’s Degree; Masters or Advanced Degree preferred
  • Knowledge of financial industry regulatory guidelines
  • Proficient in auditing principles and techniques
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in project management
  • Good understanding of programming languages (Python, SQL, R)
  • Strong understanding and experience using data visualization tools
  • A strong understanding of Data Analytics to optimize use
  • Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment.
  • Proven ability to produce, conduct, and report on internal and external research, including qualitative and quantitative metrics
  • Demonstrated ability to calculate ROI for projects of various complexity and scale
  • Working knowledge of Python, SQL, Data Visualization, UX/UI
  • Strong knowledge of Agile or other lean methodologies
  • Strong knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data technologies
  • Proficient analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Expert data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • 2+ years of experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills: Ability to explain complex Audit and Technological concepts to various stakeholders ranging from Specialists to Executives
  • Strong aptitude for Collaboration, Stakeholder Management and Relationship Management
  • Domain Knowledge and capacity to research and effectively understand innovative concepts, including but not limited to Emerging Financial Risk and Regulation, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, UX/UI, and Data Visualization

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $110,000 - $190,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

  • Drives RBC’s high performance culture
  • Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals
  • Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

USAUDIT23

Job Summary

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-11-16-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-01-16-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

item.title: Data Analytics Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analytics Analyst

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals.  These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms.  Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s).  Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit.  Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions.  Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

What will you do?

Analytics Lab Support

  • Assist in the creation and maintenance of foundational data & analytics initiatives that provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned in the platform(s).
  • Support effective delivery of a pipeline of data analytics and automation initiatives that impact Audit execution activities globally across all regions and lines of business.
  • Acts as a peer to the Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the centralized Data Management & Analytics team (DMA).
  • Empowered to challenge and refine the value of analytics ideas as proposed by the auditors.

Business Case Development and Adoption Support

  • Conduct research and identify opportunities for improving processes and technology: Externally, research best practices, emerging risks, and innovation across RBC and broadly throughout the financial sector. Internally, gather, understand, and analyse auditors’ pain points.
  • Size potential upside of deploying a solution across platforms, in line with your findings. In partnership with technical experts and other stakeholders, define and articulate ROI for your business cases for Executive Selection Committee approval.
  • Support technical builds and process reengineering aligned with business cases at every step of analytics lifecycle; engage auditors as needed and support user acceptance testing across your platforms.
  • Support the communication of ongoing work to broad Internal Audit audience and support creation of training materials and experiences for selected tools.

Technological use and Reuse

  • Support the adoption of centrally developed data products in the platform with support from the DMA team.
  • Support global adoption of IA wide data initiatives.
  • Support technology use and reuse by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the Internal Audit toolkit.
  • Assist in review of quarterly Audit plan for existing tool use to reduce duplication of efforts and to ensure technology provides expected return.
  • Support gathering and triage feedback for technical experts on an ongoing basis.

Leadership & People Development

  • Mentor team members - assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects.
  • Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors.

What do you need to succeed?

Overall

  • Good understanding of programming languages (Python, SQL, R)
  • Strong understanding and experience using data visualization tools
  • Strong understanding of Data Analytics to optimize use
  • Knowledge of financial industry regulatory guidelines
  • Knowledge of auditing principles and techniques
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in project management
  • Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment.

Technical experience:

  • Proven ability to produce, conduct, and report on internal and external research, including qualitative and quantitative metrics
  • Demonstrated ability to calculate ROI for projects of various complexity and scale
  • Working knowledge of Python, SQL, Data Visualization, UX/UI
  • Working knowledge of Agile or other lean methodologies
  • Working knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data technologies
  • Proficient analytical and problem solving skills
  • Proficient data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Proficient data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • Experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark

Leadership and People Management experience:

  • Demonstrates they have successfully worked in inclusive and diverse work teams
  • Proven ability to multitask and prioritize activities; across borders and cultures
  • Experience working as a team member on a special project, over an extended period of time

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $65,000 - $105,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

USAUDIT23

Job Summary

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals. These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms. Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s). Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit. Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions. Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

item.title: Analyst, Client Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analyst, Client Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Client Data Analytics is part of the Controls & Governance team of the Client & Data Management Group (C&DMG), provides monitoring and performance analysis for the all aspects of client onboarding and refresh activities. The analyst works with stakeholders to produce metrics for effective monitoring, timely reporting and identification of action plans around KPIs and KRIs.

What will you do?

  • Support the delivery of business analytics

  • Ensure data is consistently maintained to agreed operational and regulatory standards throughout the client lifecycle.

  • Help maintain & monitor an inventory of data & key controls showing ownership,
    frequency and SLA’s across the client lifecycle.

  • Support the development of actionable ongoing management reporting that is focused on trends and includes proactive identification and reporting of emerging risks (KPIs and KRIs).

  • Monitor the metrics from the risk and control framework and ensure that the ongoing health of the processes are monitored

  • Ensure sustainable remedial action when issues are identified.

  • Proactively identify operational risks/control deficiencies in the business and opportunities to improve the team & client experience.

  • Collaborate to create processes and monitoring tools, following a risk based approach including appropriate exception management and escalation policies.

  • Support ongoing reporting that is focused on trends and emerging risks
    from different sources of information across business units.

  • Support the creation of a consolidated view of risk and performance, including initiatives, compliance deficiencies and corrective action.

What you need to succeed?

  • Undergraduate degree

  • 2 - 3+ years of Capital Markets experience

  • Quantitative analytic skills, including experience with data analysis and data presentation

  • Strong database experience

  • Expertise in one or more of Python, VBA, and Tableau

  • MS Office, with particular expertise in Excel and PowerPoint

  • Superior verbal & written communication skills

  • Superior analytical & problem solving skills

  • Demonstrated ability to manage ambiguity in a difficult/stressful work environment

  • Demonstrated knowledge & experience with risk and quality control frameworks

  • Collaboration & team skills; with a focus on cross-group collaboration

Nice-to-haves

  • Formal qualifications as Graduate or Post-Graduate Level.

  • Knowledge of products and operations of Capital Markets, Investment Banking

  • Creative thought process and ability to innovate

  • Attention to detail while working with high volume of data and transactions

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Flexible work/life balance options

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Capital Markets

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-11-25-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-02-06-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​

item.title: Fixed Income Analytics Associate
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Fixed Income Analytics Associate

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Fixed Income Analytics Associate will actively engage in market making activity in assigned asset classes. This individual will provide Fixed Income system and technical support to all Fixed Income professionals. Provide business analysis, subject matter expertise, and application support for internally developed Fixed Income IT projects and externally developed vendor applications. Develop, enhance, and maintain tools and reporting capabilities. Assist with management/compliance reviews.

What will you do?

  • Assist with management/compliance report reviews.

  • Design, develop, and execute various trading strategies and implement new tools to satisfy business needs.

  • The incumbent is expected to be fully conversant and knowledgeable of market conditions and industry changes.

  • Build strong relationships with other internal trading desks and complement their trading activity.

  • Provide ongoing maintenance and enhancements of existing tools and reports.

  • Identify, develop, and maintain new and existing reporting capabilities to support and grow the business.

  • Work with internal RBC partners and external vendors to implement new products & services to the RBC Fixed Income platform.

  • Support vendor applications including Tradeweb Direct, Bloomberg, TMC, ICE BondPoint, Lumesis, DPC Data, CreditSights and others.

  • Identify and prioritize system enhancements, document business requirements, test, communicate, and train users as required.

  • Assess, research, analyze, document, and resolve issues and system defects.  Communicate updates and resolution to users.

  • Plan, prepare, and lead the execution of UAT test cases.

  • Serve as Fixed Income subject matter expert on enterprise projects.  Assist with analysis, business requirements, and testing.

  • Recommend technology solutions that satisfy business needs.  Continually explore and assess options for technology solutions that meet business needs.

  • Represent Fixed Income within enterprise supplier management process.  Complete or assist others in the completion of ongoing supplier management documentation.

  • Support daily activity of fixed income professionals by answering questions, provide training, resolve computer issues, troubleshoot and document system issues, communicate system changes and enhancements, and create & maintain documentation.

  • Run scheduled and ad-hoc reports.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Bachelor’s Degree is required, preferably with a concentration in Business, Finance, Economics, or Computer Science

  • Series 7 and 63 or ability to obtain within 6 months of employment

Nice-to-have

  • Ability to comprehend industry regulations as they apply to the fixed income business.

  • Experience with Microsoft Excel, Access, SQL Server, VBA, Python

  • Strong SQL writing skills

  • Ability to work in a fast paced, pressured environment with time deadlines

  • Strong interpersonal and written communication skills with ability to establish and maintain relationships at all organizational levels

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Flexible work/life balance options

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities  

  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business

Job Summary

Address:

Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States of America

City:

USA-MN-MINNEAPOLIS

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-02-02-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-02-24-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Manager, Banking and Payments Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Banking and Payments Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our Vision is to be Canadians’ leading choice for all payment and everyday banking activities, extending our market leading position through superior value, innovation, and differentiated experiences that drive acquisition and engagement.

In this role, you will be using data and analytics to improve our understanding of client behaviours, competitive positions, as well as improve in-market strategies and inform the design of our suite of products.

You will be working collaboratively with the broader Banking and Payments team, and use advanced analytical tools and multiple data sources (e.g. client segment data, bureau data, client behaviour data across all RBC products, online and mobile interaction data) in order to formulate strategies that optimize the business, enhance product construct, and provide value to our customers. You will also be responsible for designing dashboards to support business reviews with Executives and complete deep dives to explain key trends and identify strategic opportunities.

What will you do?

  • Leverage complex data to provide analytics and strategic insights for business decisions and to explore new opportunities for Banking Products, Client Growth & Engagement, including  
    • Detailed understanding of the product and segment analytics and financials
    • Business insight into acquisition and retention activities, channel performance and market share
    • Information in support of business optimization and business cases
    • Deep dives on new product innovation
    • Special projects as assigned
  • Work collaboratively with the Banking and Payments leadership team, and other analytics teams across the organization to enhance business decision-making through use of reporting, advanced analytics and combining multiple sources of data to measure key indicators of performance and early detection of opportunities, trends & anomalies.
  • Enhance reporting packages through automation to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of reports, providing management with concise, timely and insightful information on relevant matters relating to Banking and Payments portfolio.
  • Create materials to communicate the insights developed either through new monthly / quarterly reporting or specific stakeholder presentations and working sessions.
  • Work effectively with key stakeholders throughout the analytics and insights process to deliver high quality results aligned to the needs of the business.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and make data-based strategic decisions, while looking for opportunities to innovate.
  • Proficiency with data manipulation and analytical tools including Excel, SQL, SAS, Tableau, Python.
  • Proven ability to collaborate with a diverse set of stakeholders in defining and solving business problems.
  • Ability to be effective and equally conversant in business and technical environment.
  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, business, engineering) to demonstrate ability for critical thinking & numerical analytics.
  • 2+ years related work experience in analytics, product or quantitative strategy roles.

Nice to have:

  • Experience in building financial models /valuations
  • Experience with statistical tools, test design, and predictive analytics

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Analyzes and provides reports on general financial data used in selecting, creating and monitoring new or enhanced insurance products. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-02-01-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-02-14-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​

item.title: Developer - TM1 / Planning Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Developer - TM1 / Planning Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a member of EPM team and a dynamic group of technical specialists, The job involves leading the development, design, configuring and support of the financial models in line with industry best practices while collaborating with Business stakeholders and extended Finance teams. EPM technical specialists focuses on providing enterprise class design and solutions in the space of planning, budgeting, forecasting, allocations and financial consolidation to their finance partners.

What will you do?

  • Drive Implementation and lead development and technical efforts for EPM using IBM Suite of products.
  • Design innovative solution using best practices and customizing for the business specific needs.
  • Make the granular design decisions around acquiring, loading data, coding principles.
  • Be a hands-on SME advising, implementing, testing and training.
  • Communicate timely and accurate updates on the various initiatives, update on any risks following the set protocols.
  • Collaborate. You will work closely with internal and external contacts to ensure we are delivering a robust solutions meeting client’s specifications.
  • Mentor. You will support and mentor the developers and support teams.
  • Develops, codes, documents and executes unit test, system, integration and acceptance test for functions of high complexity.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have:

  • Developer experience in any one of the toolsets like IBM Planning Analytics / TM1, Anaplan, Oracle Hyperion, SAP BPC
  • Strong coding experience, development background with experience in solution and designing.
  • Programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Visual Basic and Java
  • Ability to extract, transform, and load data with a variety of data types. Skills in any ETL toolsets.
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders

Nice-to-have:

  • Integration experience on SAAS products.
  • Strong Proficiency with Excel, Building complex models & macros in excel

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Modelling and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Modelling and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?​

As an expert on Retail Banking Data and Analytics within the Capacity Optimization team this business-centric role provides actionable insights to branch leadership in support of market planning and activation activities to accelerate RBC’s market share across all personal products and markets. The individual is responsible for sourcing and analyzing internal RBC client data, external data as well as competitive and economics data to assess historical trends, develop new measures and new frameworks that provide insights and recommendations to retain, accelerate or grow RBC’s market share. 

This role is also responsible for maintaining existing statistical models as well as building new statistical/ML models as well as data files to be used as inputs into various dashboards that provide geographic level insight enabling RBC to remain competitive and win on every street corner.

What will you do?

  • Lead exploration, sourcing, preparation, interpretation, and integration of external, internal, competitive, financial and economic data sources for consumption by dashboards and models that inform sales planning and market activation activities.
  • Develop new indicators and frameworks using external sources (eg Statistics Canada, Real Estate Indices) and internal data that provide timely, relevant and actionable insights on growing market share
  • Enhance and maintain existing statistical models (eg. regression, clustering) as well as develop new predictive/ML models to improve market share as well as capacity placement decisions.
  • Partner with AMP Product Owner to enhance roadmap and to ensure dashboard load files are prepared and delivered in a timely manner.
  • Actively Participate in Agile team meetings and perform User Acceptance Testing as well as Business sign-off where required.
  • Partner with various analytics teams across the organization such as Physical Networks, Marketing, Data Science and stay abreast of latest data trends.
  • Streamline, automate, and write high quality code that is easy to understand, well documented and repeatable such that it could be consumed by production IT teams when required.
  • Provide subject matter expertise to Capacity Optimization and Regional Banking teams with insights around emerging consumer trends and its impact on retail banking products and market share through any economic cycle.
  • Other ad-hoc projects as per business need.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Strong quantitative and communication skills with an advanced Master\'s degree in one of the following: economics, statistics, business analytics or related experience.
  • 7+ years of analytics experience and ability to lead projects from idea creation to implementation
  • 3+ years of experience developing statistical models/ML models
  • Proficient in manipulating large datasets using SAS, SQL, Python, Excel
  • Strong understanding of RBC channel ecosystem, RBC data warehouse and systems
  • Prior experience working in retail analytics preferably in the financial sector
  • Curiosity and interest in data discovery, exploration as well as retail banking
  • Strong Business sense and able to anticipate needs of retail banking users
  • Innovative and creative mindset with ability to problem solve and execute
  • Demonstrated ability creating and presenting insights to a broad range of stakeholders
  • Collaborative team player with consulting mindset

Nice to have:

  • Location Intelligence/Geo Spatial experience (eg. Alteryx)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

item.title: Director – Corporate Deposits Pricing & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director – Corporate Deposits Pricing & Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

Reporting to the Head of Revenue Management, you will be responsible for

  • Designing and optimizing process flows pertaining to internal management revenues/accounting/tax/entity setup/ to best leverage USCM deposits for enterprise funding needs;
  • Partnering with Treasury on funds transfer pricing processes, balance sheet tracking and interest rate hedging  requirements;
  • Developing business performance indicators and driving analytics regarding profitability at client, product & portfolio level, in partnership with Finance;
  • Working  with Finance to review program financials and identify revenue and cost drivers for actual and forecast
     

US Cash Management USCM) Business is a unique opportunity to build the cash management business of the future from the ground up. This is an exciting time to join a start-up function within RBC, built from scratch and anchored in a technical/digital play vs. a traditional play, enabling RBC to compete with new entrants in this space!

What will you do?

  • Review and optimize the booking/tax/legal structure through the revenue lens, to best leverage USCM deposits for enterprise funding needs. This requires high fluency with cross-jurisdiction (Canada & US) regulatory rules. 

  • Partner with Treasury functions and funding desks on funds transfer pricing (FTP) approach, cash movements and establish monitoring processes to ensure accurate financial booking 

  • Define objectives & key results for business performance and perform data driven analysis of profitability at client, product and portfolio level

  • Work with Finance to review program financials and identify revenue and cost drivers for actual and forecast

People Leadership & Collaboration

  • Selects, builds, and leads a high performing process optimization and performance analytics team, leveraging individual capabilities and strengths Provides coaching, mentoring and professional development that further embeds the right culture, values, and leadership behaviors Works with team members to establish goals, drive performance management, support career development and reward strong performance.

  • Ability to forge strong relationships and routines with cross functional partners to drive strong business outcomes  

  • Partner with Corporate Treasury on any process required for internal liquidity measures, balance sheet tracking, hedging and interest rate management

  • Explore firm-wide revenue opportunities through partnership with other capital markets businesses and functional partners (legal, tax, treasury, capital markets businesses, Finance, balance sheet risks) 

What do you need to succeed?

  • Graduate degree in a related field

  • In-depth knowledge of banks’ balance sheets and ability to map out liquidity sources and uses across the enterprise

  • Fluency with Canadian and US regulatory rules applicable to cross jurisdictional activities 

  • Experience in balance sheets optimization ideally cross jurisdictions 

  • Experience in Treasury/Finance Performance Management/Financial Control  

  • Experience in leading or shaping large transformational efforts

  • High degree of business and financial acumen 

  • Able to perform data-driven analytics including the synthesis of complex data into meaningful insights

  • Able to work with x-functional teams and functional partners to design an efficient process architecture that adheres to all RBC policies and controls.

  • Required: University degree in a related field

  • Strong communication skills with ability to communicate complex messages, trade-offs and tell a compelling story

  • Ability to both grasp big picture and have rigorous attention to detail

  • Comfortable working with quick turnaround times and deadlines

  • Broad network and ability to influence across the organization is critical

Preferred

  • Experience working in transaction banking at another FI 

  • US Cash Management experience 

  • Experience leading or shaping large transformational efforts 

  • Professional designation (CFA/FRM/CPA/CA/CMA)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $200,000 - $250,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

USCASHMGMT

Job Summary

Provides the strategy, definition, development, delivery and support of IT systems and services as required to establish new or enhance existing business processes. Manages activities through senior managers and managers and implements corporate and divisional strategic plans and budgets.

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Capital Markets

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

2023-01-20-08:00

item.title: Senior Manager, Portfolio Management & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Portfolio Management & Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

As Senior Manager, Portfolio Management & Analytics, you will report to the Director, Portfolio Mgmt and Analytics. The Senior Manager will have full ownership of Stage 3 Provision for Credit Losses (PCL) portfolio analytics for the retail Credit Cards portfolio, identify trends, develop insights and new methods to assess PCL per evolving regulatory requirements, and make recommendations to Portfolio Management & Credit Strategies (PM&CS) on performance and loss forecasting.

This role gives the incumbent the opportunity to build on these strengths: cross-enterprise mindset, understanding of consumer behavior and RBC risk appetite, and adaptability to the dynamic credit environment. This position specializes in insight-generation through in-depth portfolio analytics with a focus on Stage 3 PCL.

What will you do?

  • Lead reviews around Stage 3 PCL portfolio analytics for Cards and identify trends that support recommendations on PCL mid-month and month end estimates sent to P&CB and GRM Senior Management, Five Year Outlook, Annual Plan and quarterly forecast.
  • Lead deep dive analytics and provide early warning indicators to facilitate recommendations for areas of concern to highlight to executives.
  • Develop enhanced monthly dashboard that provides transparency on Stage 3 PCL performance for increased awareness of senior leadership around the largest portfolio within Canadian banking balance sheet.   
  • Lead, as subject matter expert, in all manner of data mining activities towards PCL applications (activities include, but are not limited to: data analysis, aggregation, interpretation, and recommendation).
  • Lead preparation of Executive level presentation for PMCS, GRM and Sr. Management and Investor Relations which provides an early quarterly view of emerging Cards credit risk profile.
  • Assist Sr. Director, Portfolio Management & Analytics in preparing Executive level presentations for VP PMCS to present at P&CB Operating Committee’s Credit Risk Update.
  • Support action plans through to implementation
  • Develop and execute routines to measure and monitor effectiveness of policy and process changes to determine success and make adjustment recommendations where required
  • Support PM&CS initiatives, analytics, and adhoc requests as required

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Degree in Economics, Statistics or other quantitative field of study
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (oral and written)
  • 5+ years related work experience with SQL, SAS or equivalent programming experience, and proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint
  • Ability to be effective and equally conversant in business and technical environment
  • Proven analytical skills
  • Strong understanding of consumer behavior and credit risk
  • Proven ability to connect process, policy, system, and data together and establish impact when any of the above changes
  • Collaborative and supportive attitude
  • Creative thinker to solve complex problems
  • Ability to impact and influence is critical as this is a leadership position

Nice-to-have    

  • Knowledge of Teradata, DB2, Oracle, Tableau, Python
  • Working knowledge of Personal Financing Products.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities      
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

Job Summary

The Senior Manager will have full ownership of Stage 3 Provision for Credit Losses (PCL) portfolio analytics for the retail Credit Cards portfolio, identify trends, develop insights and new methods to assess PCL per evolving regulatory requirements, and make recommendations to Portfolio Management & Credit Strategies (PM&CS) on performance and loss forecasting.

item.title: Senior Manager, TI Business Analytics & Reporting
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, TI Business Analytics & Reporting

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

A candidate in this role will have the opportunity to grow into a variety of roles within the TI Organization, including Agile Coach, Project Manager, and Product Owner.

What will you do?

A candidate in this role is a facilitator who helps the Apptio development team adopt and follow the Scrum framework.  The main responsibilities include:

  • Guiding the team and organization in adopting Scrum values, practices and rules.
  • Facilitating events such as Sprint Planning, Daily Scrum, Sprint Review, and Sprint Retrospective.
  • Remove obstacles that are blocking the team’s progress.
  • Protect the team from external interruptions and disruptions Help the team improve its processes.
  • Ensure good collaboration and communication between teams.

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have

  • Knowledge of Scrum
  • Facilitation skills
  • Conflict resolution skills
  • Coaching skills
  • Problem-solving
  • Communication skills

Nice to Have

  • Self-starter
  • Leadership experience
  • Organizational Skills
  • Creativity
  • Sense of humor

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
